Kaplan-Meier curves for recurrence rate, OS, and RFS in the training (A—C), validation (D—F) and TCGA cohorts (G-I) based on HS. HS,
histological score; OS, overall survival; RFS, recurrence free survival.

regions.crop_image_path: /mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Exploring pathological signatures for predicting the recurrence of early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma based on deep learning/crops_ordered/page_08/region_4_text.png
regions.text:
correlation analysis in different risk subgroups of HS
(Figures 6C, D). Compared to the low-risk group, the
predominant immune cells in the high-risk group were
characterized by CD66-, CD68-, CD103- and CXCR5-
positive cells infiltrating both tumoral and peritumoral
tissues, which implied that macrophages or neutrophils
may play a potential role in the progression of recurrence.

regions.crop_image_path: /mnt/sh_flex_storage/home/zehanyu/repos/GPT-Paper/pdfs/cancer_review/Exploring pathological signatures for predicting the recurrence of early-stage hepatocellular carcinoma based on deep learning/crops_ordered/page_08/region_5_text.png
regions.text:
The immune microenvironment of cases in the TCGA
datasets was investigated by CIBERSORT algorithm (28). The
boxplot revealed significantly higher expression of monocytes
and lower expression of M2 macrophages in the HS low-risk
subgroup (Figure 6E). HS was positively correlated with the
infiltration of M2 macrophages (p= 0.011, R=0.275, Figure 6F).
Similar findings suggested an increased interaction among
